## Alert Name

**Users impacted by hallucinations exceed safe threshold**

---

## Purpose

This runbook defines the response procedure when the **percentage of users affected by hallucinated LLM responses** exceeds acceptable limits.

The objective is to **protect end users from incorrect, misleading, or unsafe outputs**, and to ensure that hallucinations do not impact a significant portion of the user base.

---

## Alert Description

This alert triggers when the **rate of users affected by hallucinations** rises above the defined Service Level Objective over the rolling evaluation window.

A breach indicates that:

* Users are receiving hallucinated responses

* Safety and trust guarantees are degrading

* Protective mechanisms may be failing to contain exposure

This condition requires prompt investigation due to direct user impact.

---

## Service Level Objective (SLO)

SLO Link - [https://us5.datadoghq.com/slo/manage?sp=%5B%7B%22p%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A%22140a4691d3715dd1bd21d939f86b08ef%22%2C%22timeFrame%22%3A%7B%22start%22%3A1766577656228%2C%22end%22%3A1767182456228%2C%22mode%22%3A%22sliding%22%2C%22fromUser%22%3Afalse%2C%22paused%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22i%22%3A%22slo-panel%22%7D%5D](https://us5.datadoghq.com/slo/manage?sp=%5B%7B%22p%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A%22140a4691d3715dd1bd21d939f86b08ef%22%2C%22timeFrame%22%3A%7B%22start%22%3A1766577656228%2C%22end%22%3A1767182456228%2C%22mode%22%3A%22sliding%22%2C%22fromUser%22%3Afalse%2C%22paused%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22i%22%3A%22slo-panel%22%7D%5D)

 

Monitor Link - [https://us5.datadoghq.com/monitors/17356359](https://us5.datadoghq.com/monitors/17356359)

 

| Parameter| Value|
|-|-|
| SLO Type| Ratio-based|
| Good Events| Users not affected by hallucinated responses|
| Bad Events| Users affected by hallucinations|
| Rolling Window| 7 days|
| Target| ≥ 85% unaffected users|
| Warning Threshold| < 90%|
| Critical Threshold| < 85%|

---

## Impact Assessment

An elevated affected users rate may result in:

* Users receiving incorrect or unsafe guidance

* Loss of user trust and engagement

* Increased support or complaint volume

* Regulatory or ethical concerns in sensitive domains

* Expanded hallucination blast radius

This alert represents a **direct safety and experience risk**.

---

## Initial Triage Checklist

Confirm the following:

* Is the increase sudden or gradual?

* Are specific user personas more affected?

* Is the issue limited to certain prompt types or flows?

* Did the increase follow a deployment, model change, or prompt update?

---

## Investigation Steps

### 1. Identify Affected User Segments

Review dashboards:

* Affected users over time

* Persona-based blast radius

* Hallucination severity by user group

Determine:

* Which personas are impacted (age, skin concern, sensitivity)

* Whether high-risk users are disproportionately affected

---

### 2. Analyze Hallucination Severity

Correlate affected users with:

* Hallucination score trends

* Clean vs flagged response ratios

Determine whether:

* Many users are affected by low-severity hallucinations, or

* Fewer users are affected by high-severity hallucinations

This guides containment priority.

---

### 3. Validate Safety Controls

Review:

* Pre-filter accuracy

* Evaluation trigger rate

* Detection success rate

Confirm whether:

* Risky prompts are bypassing safety controls

* Evaluation gating is too permissive

---

### 4. Correlate with Traffic Patterns

Check:

* Traffic spikes or unusual user behavior

* New onboarding flows or campaigns

* Load-related degradation in safety checks

High traffic can amplify user exposure.

---

## Mitigation Actions

Based on findings, take appropriate action:

* Increase hallucination evaluation coverage temporarily

* Tighten pre-filter thresholds for high-risk prompts

* Route sensitive personas to stricter validation workflows

* Roll back recent model or prompt changes

* Disable high-risk response patterns if necessary

---

## Verification Steps

After mitigation:

* Confirm affected users rate is decreasing

* Validate hallucination scores are stabilizing

* Ensure no new personas are entering the affected group

* Monitor metrics for at least one full rolling window

---

## Escalation Guidelines

Escalate if:

* Affected users rate remains above critical threshold

* High-risk personas continue to be impacted

* Mitigation actions fail to reduce exposure

Escalation path:

1. AI Engineering

2. Safety & Policy Team

3. Product Owner

4. Incident Commander

---

## Post-Incident Actions

Once resolved:

* Document root cause and timeline

* Improve safety controls or evaluation logic

* Add early-warning alerts for rising user exposure

* Review persona risk weighting

* Update dashboards and runbooks if gaps are identified

## Alert Name

**LLM hallucination pre-filter accuracy below target**

---

## Purpose

This runbook defines the response procedure when the **hallucination pre-filter accuracy** falls below the defined threshold.

The pre-filter acts as the **first line of defense** in the LLM safety pipeline, determining whether prompts require deeper hallucination evaluation. Maintaining high accuracy ensures that:

* Risky prompts are intercepted early

* Safe prompts are not unnecessarily escalated

* Evaluation costs remain controlled

* Safety guarantees remain intact

---

## Alert Description

This alert triggers when the **percentage of evaluated prompts correctly flagged by the pre-filter** drops below the defined Service Level Objective over the rolling evaluation window.

A breach indicates that the pre-filter is either:

* Missing risky prompts (false negatives), or

* Over-triggering evaluation unnecessarily (false positives)

Both conditions degrade system safety and efficiency.

---

## Service Level Objective (SLO)

SLO Link - [https://us5.datadoghq.com/slo/manage?sp=%5B%7B%22p%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A%22881f142d4767505f805d03c0fe2983d2%22%2C%22timeFrame%22%3A%7B%22start%22%3A1766577369447%2C%22end%22%3A1767182169447%2C%22mode%22%3A%22sliding%22%2C%22fromUser%22%3Afalse%2C%22paused%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22i%22%3A%22slo-panel%22%7D%5D](https://us5.datadoghq.com/slo/manage?sp=%5B%7B%22p%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A%22881f142d4767505f805d03c0fe2983d2%22%2C%22timeFrame%22%3A%7B%22start%22%3A1766577369447%2C%22end%22%3A1767182169447%2C%22mode%22%3A%22sliding%22%2C%22fromUser%22%3Afalse%2C%22paused%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22i%22%3A%22slo-panel%22%7D%5D)

 

Monitor Link - [https://us5.datadoghq.com/monitors/17356210](https://us5.datadoghq.com/monitors/17356210)

 

| Parameter| Value|
|-|-|
| SLO Type| Count-based|
| Good Events| Evaluated prompts correctly flagged by pre-filter|
| Bad Events| Evaluated prompts missed or incorrectly classified|
| Rolling Window| 7 days|
| Target| ≥ 75%|
| Warning Threshold| < 85%|
| Critical Threshold| < 75%|

---

## Impact Assessment

Reduced pre-filter accuracy can lead to:

* Unsafe prompts bypassing hallucination checks

* Increased hallucination exposure to users

* Unnecessary downstream evaluation costs

* Degraded trust in safety controls

* Increased blast radius if combined with high traffic

This alert signals a **safety and efficiency regression**, not just a classification issue.

---

## Initial Triage Checklist

Confirm the following:

* Is accuracy degradation sudden or gradual?

* Are specific risk categories affected more than others?

* Did the issue start after a prompt, rule, or model update?

* Is traffic volume or prompt distribution changing?

---

## Investigation Steps

### 1. Review Risk Classification Distribution

Analyze metrics:

* `llm.prefilter.trigger.medical_claim`

* `llm.prefilter.trigger.absolute_claim`

* `llm.prefilter.trigger.unsafe_ingredient`

* `llm.prefilter.trigger.json_format_violation`

Check for:

* Missing expected triggers

* Sudden shifts in category distribution

---

### 2. Compare Prefilter Decisions vs Evaluation Outcomes

Review:

* Evaluated vs non-evaluated outcome trends

* Clean vs flagged evaluation results

Identify:

* False negatives (risky prompts missed)

* False positives (safe prompts escalated)

---

### 3. Validate Prefilter Rules and Thresholds

Inspect:

* Rule logic and scoring thresholds

* Keyword or pattern matching logic

* Prompt classification heuristics

Ensure recent updates did not unintentionally reduce sensitivity.

---

### 4. Correlate with Prompt and Persona Changes

Check whether:

* New prompt formats are bypassing rules

* Certain personas or concerns are misclassified

* New user flows are not covered by existing logic

---

## Mitigation Actions

Depending on findings:

* Tighten pre-filter thresholds for high-risk categories

* Add or refine classification rules

* Temporarily increase evaluation coverage

* Roll back recent pre-filter changes

* Introduce fallback evaluation for ambiguous prompts

---

## Verification Steps

After mitigation:

* Confirm pre-filter accuracy returns above warning threshold

* Validate risk category distribution stability

* Ensure downstream evaluation load is within expectations

* Monitor accuracy metrics for at least one full rolling window

---

## Escalation Guidelines

Escalate if:

* Risky prompts continue to bypass the pre-filter

* Accuracy does not recover after mitigation

* High-risk personas are impacted

Escalation path:

1. AI Engineering

2. Safety & Policy Team

3. Observability / Platform Team

4. Product Owner

---

## Post-Incident Actions

Once resolved:

* Document root cause and contributing factors

* Improve test coverage for pre-filter rules

* Add early-warning alerts for accuracy drift

* Update dashboards or thresholds if needed

* Review alignment with blast radius and quality SLOs

---

## Alert Name

**Hallucinations scores are unstable**

---

## Purpose

This runbook defines the response procedure when the **hallucination rate of LLM responses exceeds acceptable limits**.

The goal is to **maintain response correctness, safety, and trustworthiness**, ensuring that the LLM does not produce misleading, unsafe, or fabricated information at scale.

This alert focuses on **model output quality**, not system availability.

---

## Alert Description

This alert triggers when the **percentage of hallucinated responses** crosses the defined threshold over a rolling evaluation window.

A breach indicates that:

* The model is generating factually incorrect or unsafe outputs

* Safety guarantees are degrading

* Users may receive misleading guidance

This condition requires **immediate investigation**, especially in safety-sensitive domains such as skincare, medical advice, or ingredient recommendations.

---

## Service Level Objective (SLO)

SLO Link - [https://us5.datadoghq.com/slo/manage?sp=%5B%7B%22p%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A%22560e7b29b7db5fce8d7dc111440da64e%22%2C%22timeFrame%22%3A%7B%22start%22%3A1766577198755%2C%22end%22%3A1767181998755%2C%22mode%22%3A%22sliding%22%2C%22fromUser%22%3Afalse%2C%22paused%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22i%22%3A%22slo-panel%22%7D%5D](https://us5.datadoghq.com/slo/manage?sp=%5B%7B%22p%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A%22560e7b29b7db5fce8d7dc111440da64e%22%2C%22timeFrame%22%3A%7B%22start%22%3A1766577198755%2C%22end%22%3A1767181998755%2C%22mode%22%3A%22sliding%22%2C%22fromUser%22%3Afalse%2C%22paused%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22i%22%3A%22slo-panel%22%7D%5D)

 

Monitor Link - [https://us5.datadoghq.com/monitors/17326627](https://us5.datadoghq.com/monitors/17326627)

 

| Parameter| Value|
|-|-|
| SLO Type| Ratio-based|
| Good Events| Clean (non-hallucinated) evaluated responses|
| Bad Events| Flagged hallucinated responses|
| Rolling Window| 7 days|
| Target| ≥ 75% clean responses|
| Warning Threshold| < 85%|
| Critical Threshold| < 75%|

---

## Impact Assessment

An elevated hallucination rate can lead to:

* Incorrect skincare or health guidance

* Brand trust erosion

* Regulatory and compliance risks

* Increased user harm potential

* Escalation of blast radius when combined with high traffic

Severity increases if hallucinations affect **high-risk personas or common user flows**.

---

## Initial Triage Checklist

Confirm the following:

* Is the hallucination rate increasing steadily or spiking suddenly?

* Is the issue isolated to a specific model version?

* Are particular prompt types or intents affected?

* Did the issue coincide with a deployment, prompt update, or model switch?

---

## Investigation Steps

### 1. Analyze Hallucination Score Trends

Review:

* `llm.hallucination.score`

* `llm.hallucination.flagged.count`

* Clean vs flagged response ratios

Determine:

* Severity of hallucinations (low confidence vs critical)

* Whether issues are widespread or localized

---

### 2. Identify Affected Prompt Categories

Correlate hallucinations with:

* Medical or absolute claims

* Ingredient safety recommendations

* Routine sequencing advice

* JSON formatting or schema outputs

This helps isolate **prompt sensitivity weaknesses**.

---

### 3. Correlate with Model and Version

Check:

* Hallucination rate by `model_name`

* Recent model upgrades or configuration changes

* Differences between primary generation model and validation model

Determine if rollback is necessary.

---

### 4. Evaluate Blast Radius

Cross-reference with:

* Total chat volume

* Persona risk weight

* Affected user count

High hallucination rate combined with high exposure indicates **elevated real-world risk**.

---

## Mitigation Actions

Based on findings:

* Roll back to a previous stable prompt or model version

* Increase evaluation strictness for high-risk prompts

* Narrow allowed response patterns

* Introduce stronger grounding instructions

* Route sensitive prompts to stricter validation workflows

* Temporarily reduce output verbosity

---

## Verification Steps

After mitigation:

* Confirm hallucination rate returns below warning threshold

* Validate clean vs flagged ratio stability

* Review recent evaluated responses manually

* Monitor for at least one full rolling window

---

## Escalation Guidelines

Escalate if:

* Hallucination rate remains above critical threshold

* High-risk personas are affected

* Mitigation attempts do not reduce severity

Escalation path:

1. AI Engineering

2. Safety & Policy Team

3. Product Owner

4. Incident Commander

---

## Post-Incident Actions

Once stabilized:

* Document root cause (prompt, model, or data drift)

* Improve prefilter or grounding logic

* Add early-warning monitors for rising hallucination trends

* Review SLO thresholds for realism

* Update evaluation datasets if bias or gaps are found

---

attributes.name: Runbook: LLM Hallucination Detection Error Rate Elevation

definition.text:
## Alert Name

**Hallucination Detection Success Rate below target**

---

## Purpose

This runbook defines the response procedure when the **hallucination detection pipeline itself becomes unreliable**. The objective is to **restore the accuracy and availability of hallucination detection**, ensuring that unsafe or misleading LLM outputs are not silently passing through due to detection failures.

This alert focuses on **observability correctness**, not model quality.

---

## Alert Description

This alert triggers when the **hallucination detection error rate** exceeds the acceptable threshold over the configured rolling window.

A breach indicates failures such as:

* Hallucination detection service errors

* JSON parsing or schema validation failures

* Evaluation model timeouts or malformed responses

* Downstream detection pipeline instability

When this occurs, hallucinations may go **undetected**, increasing safety and compliance risk.

---

## Service Level Objective (SLO)

SLO Link - [https://us5.datadoghq.com/slo/manage?sp=%5B%7B%22p%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A%22f71c2610f6af5a8299bf18c0e6d28a28%22%2C%22timeFrame%22%3A%7B%22start%22%3A1766576913949%2C%22end%22%3A1767181713949%2C%22mode%22%3A%22sliding%22%2C%22fromUser%22%3Afalse%2C%22paused%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22i%22%3A%22slo-panel%22%7D%5D](https://us5.datadoghq.com/slo/manage?sp=%5B%7B%22p%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A%22f71c2610f6af5a8299bf18c0e6d28a28%22%2C%22timeFrame%22%3A%7B%22start%22%3A1766576913949%2C%22end%22%3A1767181713949%2C%22mode%22%3A%22sliding%22%2C%22fromUser%22%3Afalse%2C%22paused%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22i%22%3A%22slo-panel%22%7D%5D)

 

Monitor Link - [https://us5.datadoghq.com/monitors/17356156](https://us5.datadoghq.com/monitors/17356156)

 

| Parameter| Value|
|-|-|
| SLO Type| Count-based|
| Good Events| Successful hallucination detection outcomes|
| Bad Events| Detection failures and parsing errors|
| Rolling Window| 7 days|
| Target| ≥ 75%|
| Warning Threshold| < 85%|
| Critical Threshold| < 75%|

---

## Impact Assessment

An elevated detection error rate results in **loss of trust in safety signals**. Potential impacts include:

* Unsafe responses not being flagged

* False sense of system reliability

* Inaccurate dashboards and alerts

* Increased blast radius due to blind spots

Immediate investigation is required.

---

## Initial Triage Checklist

Confirm the following:

* Is the failure rate increasing suddenly or gradually?

* Are errors localized to a specific model or request type?

* Are failures systemic or tied to specific personas or prompts?

* Did the issue begin after a deployment or configuration change?

---

## Investigation Steps

### 1. Identify Failure Type Distribution

Review error metrics:

* `llm.errors.hallucination_detection_failure`

* `llm.errors.json_parsing_failure`

* Evaluation timeout or schema mismatch metrics

Determine:

* Whether failures are model-related or infrastructure-related

* Which failure type dominates

---

### 2. Inspect Detection Model Health

Validate:

* Evaluation model availability and latency

* Token limits and output truncation

* Schema compliance of evaluation responses

Check if:

* The evaluation model is returning incomplete or malformed outputs

* Rate limiting or quota exhaustion is occurring

---

### 3. Validate Input and Output Schema Contracts

Review recent changes to:

* Prompt templates

* JSON schemas

* Detection output format

Ensure:

* Schema versions match across services

* No backward compatibility issues were introduced

---

### 4. Correlate with Traffic and Cost Metrics

Analyze:

* Spike in evaluation volume

* Token usage anomalies

* Cost or throughput saturation

High load may degrade detection reliability.

---

## Mitigation Actions

Depending on root cause:

* Temporarily reduce evaluation scope to essential risk categories

* Roll back recent prompt or schema changes

* Route detection to fallback validation logic

* Increase evaluation model timeouts or token limits

* Enable stricter input validation before evaluation

---

## Verification Steps

After mitigation:

* Confirm detection error metrics are decreasing

* Validate successful evaluation completion rates

* Ensure hallucination dashboards reflect stable data

* Monitor for at least one full evaluation window

---

## Escalation Guidelines

Escalate if:

* Detection failures persist after rollback

* Safety guarantees cannot be validated

* Detection outputs cannot be trusted

Escalation path:

1. AI Engineering

2. Safety / Policy

3. Observability / Platform Engineering

4. Incident Commander

---

## Post-Incident Actions

Once resolved:

* Document root cause and contributing factors

* Improve schema validation robustness

* Add early-warning alerts for detection degradation

* Update evaluation fallback mechanisms

* Review SLO thresholds if required

---

attributes.name: Runbook: LLM Hallucination Blast Radius Control

definition.text:
## Alert Name

**Hallucination blast radius exceeds safe threshold**

---

## Purpose

This runbook defines the operational response when the **hallucination blast radius SLO** is breached. The objective is to **contain the spread and impact of hallucinations**, especially those affecting **high-risk user personas**, and to **prevent harmful or misleading responses from reaching a large audience**.

This alert prioritizes **impact over frequency**, focusing on _who_ is affected rather than _how often_ hallucinations occur.

---

## Alert Description

This alert triggers when the **percentage of unaffected users** falls below the defined Service Level Objective over the rolling evaluation window.

A breach indicates that hallucinations are:

* Reaching a growing number of users

* Affecting sensitive user personas (age, skin type, medical concerns)

* Increasing real-world risk beyond acceptable limits

---

## Service Level Objective (SLO)

SLO Link - [https://us5.datadoghq.com/slo/manage?sp=%5B%7B%22p%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A%22314ceabac2795dc78562bdf559dced6f%22%2C%22timeFrame%22%3A%7B%22start%22%3A1766576496282%2C%22end%22%3A1767181296282%2C%22mode%22%3A%22sliding%22%2C%22fromUser%22%3Afalse%2C%22paused%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22i%22%3A%22slo-panel%22%7D%5D](https://us5.datadoghq.com/slo/manage?sp=%5B%7B%22p%22%3A%7B%22id%22%3A%22314ceabac2795dc78562bdf559dced6f%22%2C%22timeFrame%22%3A%7B%22start%22%3A1766576496282%2C%22end%22%3A1767181296282%2C%22mode%22%3A%22sliding%22%2C%22fromUser%22%3Afalse%2C%22paused%22%3Afalse%7D%7D%2C%22i%22%3A%22slo-panel%22%7D%5D)

 

Monitor Link - [https://us5.datadoghq.com/monitors/17356223](https://us5.datadoghq.com/monitors/17356223)

 

| Parameter| Value|
|-|-|
| SLO Type| Count-based|
| Indicator| Unaffected users / Total chats|
| Rolling Window| 7 days|
| Target| ≥ 85%|
| Warning Threshold| < 90%|
| Critical Threshold| < 85%|

---

## Impact Assessment

When this alert fires, the system is experiencing **uncontrolled hallucination propagation**. Potential consequences include:

* Medical misinformation

* Unsafe skincare recommendations

* Loss of user trust

* Regulatory or ethical risk

Immediate containment is required.

---

## Initial Triage Checklist

Verify the following before deep investigation:

* Is the increase sudden or gradual?

* Are specific user personas disproportionately affected?

* Is the hallucination severity increasing, or just exposure?

* Did the issue begin after a model, prompt, or policy change?

---

## Investigation Steps

### 1. Identify Affected User Segments

Review dashboards:

* Hallucination Blast Radius Index (HBRS)

* Risk Matrix by Persona

* Hallucination Score Distribution

Confirm:

* Which personas are affected (age, skin concern, sensitivity)

* Whether high-risk groups are impacted

---

### 2. Analyze Hallucination Severity vs Exposure

Check:

* Average hallucination score trends

* Total chat volume correlation

* Whether impact is caused by:

  * High severity, low volume events

  * Low severity, high volume events

This determines containment strategy.

---

### 3. Validate Evaluation Gating Effectiveness

Review:

* Evaluation trigger rate

* Prefilter classification distribution

* Percentage of evaluated vs non-evaluated chats

Confirm whether:

* Risky prompts are being correctly routed for evaluation

* Gating thresholds are too permissive

---

### 4. Review Recent Changes

Check for:

* Model version upgrades

* Prompt or system instruction changes

* Prefilter rule updates

* Persona risk weight adjustments

Roll back changes if a regression is identified.

---

## Containment Actions

Depending on findings, take one or more of the following actions:

* Increase hallucination evaluation coverage temporarily

* Lower prefilter thresholds for high-risk categories

* Route high-risk personas to stricter validation models

* Disable specific response patterns or flows

* Apply prompt hotfixes to constrain unsafe outputs

---

## Verification Steps

After containment actions:

* Confirm affected user percentage is decreasing

* Validate hallucination scores are stabilizing

* Ensure no new personas are entering the affected set

* Monitor blast radius metrics for at least one evaluation cycle

---

## Escalation Guidelines

Escalate immediately if:

* Medical or safety-critical hallucinations persist

* High-risk personas continue to be affected

* Automated controls fail to contain spread

Escalation path:

1. AI Engineering

2. Safety / Policy Review

3. Product Owner

4. Incident Commander (if applicable)

---

## Post-Incident Actions

Once stabilized:

* Document root cause and timeline

* Update risk thresholds or persona weights

* Improve evaluation selectivity or coverage

* Update dashboards or alerts if blind spots are identified

* Review this runbook for gaps

---

## Alert Name

**Skinnova Website Availability SLO**

---

## Purpose

This runbook provides step-by-step guidance for responding to alerts triggered when the **Skinnova website availability SLO** breaches its defined threshold. The goal is to **quickly identify the cause of downtime**, **restore user access**, and **minimize user impact** while preserving service reliability.

---

## Alert Description

This alert is triggered when the **percentage of successful website availability checks** falls below the defined Service Level Objective over the configured rolling time window.

A violation indicates that users may be **unable to access the Skinnova application**, impacting trust, engagement, and downstream AI interactions.

---

| Target| ≥ 99%|
| Warning Threshold| < 99.5%|
| Critical Threshold| < 99%|

---

## Initial Assessment Checklist

When this alert fires, immediately verify:

* Is the website currently unreachable for users?

* Is the outage intermittent or sustained?

* Are errors global or region-specific?

* Did the issue coincide with a recent deployment or configuration change?

---

## Investigation Steps

### 1. Confirm Website Status

* Open the Skinnova website in a browser

* Check access from multiple networks or regions (VPN if available)

* Review Datadog **Synthetics → Uptime Monitor** results

---

### 2. Check Infrastructure Health

* Review host-level metrics:

  * CPU usage

  * Memory utilization

  * Disk saturation

* Validate container and VM status

* Ensure no resource exhaustion is occurring

---

### 3. Inspect Backend Service Health

* Verify API availability (FastAPI / backend services)

* Check recent **5xx error spikes** in APM

* Inspect request latency trends

---

### 4. Review Deployment & Configuration Changes

* Confirm if a recent frontend, backend, or infrastructure deployment occurred

* Validate:

  * Environment variables

  * Secrets and credentials

  * NGINX configuration

* Roll back recent changes if necessary

---

### 5. Validate Networking & Dependencies

* Check:

  * Load balancer health

  * DNS resolution

  * Firewall or security group changes

* Confirm upstream dependencies (Vertex AI, third-party APIs) are operational

---

## Remediation Actions

Based on findings, take appropriate action:

* Restart affected containers or services

* Roll back faulty deployments

* Scale resources if under-provisioned

* Fix misconfigurations (NGINX, routing, TLS)

* Restore networking connectivity

---

## Post-Recovery Validation

After remediation:

* Confirm the website is accessible from multiple regions

* Ensure synthetic uptime checks return to **PASS**

* Verify error rates and latency stabilize

* Monitor SLO burn rate for at least 15–30 minutes

---

## Documentation & Follow-Up

* Record incident details:

  * Root cause

  * Time to detect

  * Time to resolve

* Create a follow-up task if:

  * A deployment caused the outage

  * Automation or alerts can be improved

* Update this runbook if gaps were identified
